items.description: River Cole, Dorcan Brook and South Marston Brook
items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected. 

River levels are still high, but falling on the River Cole following this afternoon's heavy rainfall. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue this afternoon and evening  31/07/2025, especially in the Lower Stratton Area.

Further heavy rainfall is forecast for this afternoon and early evening. 
We are monitoring the situation. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. 

Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 

This message will be updated by tomorrow morning, 01/08/2025, or as the situation changes.

The water level in the West Brook at Bridge Road is rising rapidly and has increased by 0.5m in the last 2 hours.
In the last hour, close to half a monthâ€™s rain (25mm) has been recorded in Walderton. This is a very large volume in a short period of time.
Due to the intensity and volume of the rain which has already fallen, from 16:00 this afternoon (31 July 2025) Bridge Road will be flooding. Water in the river will also rise to bank full over the next half an hour and it may also come out of bank. This will increase flood depths in the road and at the riverside car park, but flooding of property directly from the river is not expected.
Heavy rain will continue to affect the area for the next few hours. Water levels will remain very high over the next few hours but should fall by 19:00 hours.
We are also keeping debris screens at Bridge Road clear of blockages.
As a precautionary measure, we would encourage residents with flood protection products to install them now.  
This Flood Alert will be updated by 20:00 on 31 July.
